headline: Pumpkin Muffins with Streusel Topping
description: Moist and hearty pumpkin-oat muffins are topped with a brown sugar and oat streusel perfect for a quick breakfast or a holiday brunch.
name: Pumpkin Muffins with Streusel Topping

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease or line 18 muffin cups with paper liners.

Combine 2 1/2 cups flour, 1/2 cup oats, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl. Whisk pumpkin puree, 1 cup brown sugar, white sugar, vegetable oil, applesauce, eggs, and vanilla extract together in a separate large bowl. Stir flour mixture into pumpkin mixture; mix well. Fold in raisins.
Beat 1/4 cup brown sugar with butter in a bowl until creamy and smooth. Whisk 2 tablespoons oats and 2 tablespoons flour, using a fork, into sugar-butter mixture until streusel topping is crumbly.
Pour the batter into the prepared muffin tin. Sprinkle each muffin with streusel topping.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, 25 to 35 minutes.

review.reviewBody: The muffin portion of the recipe was great, but I did not like the consistency of the topping. I doubled the topping as others suggested and it was gooey and globby, making the finished product look messy. Next time I will not melt the butter but cut in cold butter to make it more crumbly.
Yummo! Double your topping measurements :)

Very moist and yummy. I added more cinnamon, cloves and ginger but I always add extra warm spices to any Fall flavored recipe so that isn't a criticism. I also exchanged the raisins for chocolate chips. My husband loved them. I have a lot of food allergies and this recipe did very well with exchanging ingredients, not all do. I substituted a different protein for the eggs and butter flavored crisco for the butter, I used splenda white and brown sugars.
Followed the recipe exactly and they came out perfect!
This is my favorite pumpkin muffin. It’s sweet, moist, and perfectly spiced. I’ve made it for years and compared it to many others…this one is superior! Do yourself a favor and double the topping.
Best muffins EVER! Everyone is right! Double the streusel Topping!
Makes more muffins than 18, I got 23.
These muffins are delicious. The next time I made this recipe, I will use less batter per muffin. I used about 1/3 cup and they overflowed. I also would double the streusel topping.
very yummy..I had left over cream cheese icing to use...thanks for this recipe

These are delicious! Had to make some changes because we didn’t have any applesauce on hand. Added and extra half cup of fresh pumpkin purée and half a banana as a substitute. Also had to use steel cut oats instead of rolled. Pandemic substitutes for sure. But these are super easy to make and so very tasty.

I had 3/4c pumpkin left from another recipe, so I halved the recipe and added 1/4c+ mashed banana and no applesauce as I didn't have any. Also didn't want the mess of cupcake tins so made in an 8x8 pan. Light and delicious!

Yummmmmy! I too used the entire can of pumpkin. I didn’t have applesauce so I used 1/4 cup milk, and another tablespoon of oil. I used pumpkin seeds for the top and have some cream cheese frosting for anyone who wants. Nice crumb texture to these. The family dove in!

Awesome. Added more raisins than the recipe called for. Cut sugar by 1/4 cup. Didn't add streusel because I don't like them too sweet and they really didn't needed it. They came out great and taste delicious. This recipe is a keeper.

Bland bland bland. Omg bland. The whole family said not enough pumpkin spice. Not sweet enough and not moist or complex enough. They all complained. I even used more than the recipe and it wasn’t enough for us. I also think it isn’t as moist as it could be if I had used butter instead of applesauce... I think some more brown sugar and the pumpkin pie spice in the strussel crumb would really make this better. They came out beautiful it lacked oomph.
Very tasty, doesnt even need the streusel on top! it was a hit with the kids and uses up any left over pumpkin puree.
These muffins turned out simply amazing!!

These are delicious! I reduced the white sugar in half and added a little more brown sugar. 12 had the streusel topping with nuts added, the rest cream cheese frosting. My family requests them at least 1x a month!

It made so many amazing muffins! I used coconut oil for the oil, cut the white sugar in half, replaced raisins with walnuts, and used 2 cups pumpkin. The streusal is the perfect compliment to these gems and doesn't fall off like most do. Will defs be making these again!

These are very good pumpkin muffins! I think you could probably cut down on the sugar just a little bit, but they’re good as is if you like a little bit sweeter muffin. The only change I made was to add some chopped pecans. This is a keeper.

Delicious! Everyone loved these! I used fresh pumpkin and only 2 eggs (all I had). Doubled the toppings as suggested by reviewers and added pecans. Yum! Still didn’t have enough topping for all 2 dozen so I put cream cheese topping on the remaining few before serving and that was delicious too.

I used baked sweet potatoes instead of pumpkins and they were delicious! I have also made it with pumpkin, left out the cup of white sugar entirely, still delicious. Substituted one of the cups of flour for whole wheat flour. My kids don't like raisins, left them out. I didn't have pumpkin pie spice, used 1 tsp cinnamon + 1/2 tsp cloves + 1/2 tsp ginger. Doubled the crumb topping. Filled the muffin cups only halfway as they rise nicely. Baked 20 minutes vs. 25 as they get a little dark otherwise. These are SO good.

Amazing muffins! I didn't have applesauce, so I used a cup of oil and the full 15 oz can of pumpkin. I also didn't have pumpkin pie spice, so I use another commenter's suggestion of 2.5 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp ginger, and 1/2 tsp cloves. I also didn't make the topping because I was really hungry, but they are the best muffins I have ever made! I am sure the topping would just make them that much better.
Great muffins!
This is my whole families favorite muffin recipe!! It is so yummy!
This wasdelicious, my whole family loved it .Perfect breakfast or snack.

These muffins were awesome. They were very moist and flavourful. I used 2cups of pumpkin and I replaced a 1/3 of the oil with applesauce. As suggested by others I made double the amount of topping. The recipe made 17 good sized muffins. I will make these again for sure.

Amazing! I did take a couple suggestions from other reviewers like tripling the strudel mixture & adding pecans as well as stuffing with cream cheese. These muffins are to die for! A permanent addition to my cache of recipes!

I rated a 3 because of my mistake of forgetting the applesauce. This made the muffins a little dry. Cooked at the correct temperature and time. I'm guessing the applesauce really makes it more moist. Don't know if I want to waste this much ingredients again. Maybe try again in 6 months. They look great, just not moist and not enough flavor. Don't think I'll be sharing with my neighbors.
Excellent! I do 1/2 WW pastry flour and regular flour and I reduced the sugar. I also add 1 scoop of bone broth powder.

Ugh. Bland. I was soooo looking forward to a nice cup of coffee and a muffin and I was disappointed. I followed the directions exactly. I will stick to making the downeast maine pumpkin bread from this site. I should never have strayed!

Love these! I made a few changes due to what I had on hand. Only had 1 cup pumpkin so added 1/2 cup of crushed pineapple and added walnuts instead of raisins. Also replaced more of the oil with applesauce. I used a Splenda blend for both the white and brown sugars. Will make again, this is a keeper!
Fantastic recipe! I made as written except used the entire 15 oz can of pumpkin as others suggested and doubled the streusel. Really, yum!
Muffins were delicious. I made more streusel topping then the recipe called for but the more topping the better

Made these today. They are so fluffy and light. I ended up with 31 regular sized muffins! I'm glad I followed the reviews that suggested to double the crumble. While the first batch was baking, I put the extra crumble in the refrigerator. It was much easier to use on the second batch. I subbed dairy-free butter.
I doubled the topping and the raisins. Everything else was good. It really is a good recipe. I made 12 muffins and a loaf. Which took a long time to cook but is delicious.
Yummy! Turned out great.
These muffins were delicious - the streusel topping was really special. Why not 5 stars? I’m not sure about the oats texture throughout. I guess I’m used to traditional pumpkin muffins!
Delicious flavor and texture! I did double the streusel topping to have enough for all the muffins. I halved the sugar in the recipe. They turned out perfect!

Delish. I halved the recipe and made my purée from scratch but I found that 11 muffins were made From the batter and they cooked in 25 mins. I also made a mistake and forgot to add the salt so I mixed it into the crumb mix and it was still amazing

Lovely, lovely recipe! These were very moist and I found the flavours were even better the next day. Highly recommend!

My muffin liners were “regular” so I actually got 24 muffins.

These were delicious! It makes a LOT so if you don't want a ton of leftovers cut down on the ingredients. I did freeze most of the leftovers and they were fine when defrosted for breakfast or a snack.

I did my best to mess this recipe up, but it came out great anyway. I must have gotten the second tsp of baking powder out well that I put in by mistake. Getting older, and so cooking can be a challenge at times. I didn't change a thing. They are moist and delicious, and I can't wait to share them with my family.

I did my best to mess this recipe up, but it came out great anyway. I must have gotten the second tsp of baking powder out well that I put in by mistake. Getting older, and so cooking can be a challenge at times. I didn't change a thing. They are moist and delicious, and I can't wait to share them with my family.
I will make this again. YUMM

This is a great muffin! Next time I will take the advice of others and make more streusel topping as this muffin is not too sweet. I also plan to mix in some chopped pecans to the topping. I will also add two extra teaspoons of pumpkin spice to the recipe. I did not use raisins, as my family does not like them.
I doubled the recipe and they were really good and went way too quickly. Will make again.
No changes
These were the perfect fall muffin. I did not have applesauce so I used sour cream instead. I was also out of raisin and nutmeg. They were delicious even without the missing ingredients.

These are SO good!!! I only had 1 egg to use, so I threw in 1 mashed banana and 1/4 C of flax seed in place of the other 2 eggs, and the muffins turned out to be fabulous. I skipped the streusel topping because I wanted to freeze the muffins for breakfasts throughout the month, and they were plenty sweet enough without it. Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!
Made it as written very yummy!!!
No, just the same changes other made: double the topping and use the whole can of pumpkin.
No, just the same changes other made: double the topping and use the whole can of pumpkin.
Loved this recipe. Tripled the topping. Made 24 nice size muffins.

These muffins are were a huge hit with everyone I shared them with. I used sugar substitute for the white sugar, doubled the streusel topping and added a 1/2 cup of chopped pecans. The muffins were fluffy and delicious and the pumpkin flavor really shone through. The next batch I plan to try with dried cranberries for an extra Fall kick. Excellent recipe!
I made exactly as written. I made 12 full sized muffins and 24 minis. I had plenty of topping for all. Yummy.
Kids loved these - used the whole can of pumpkin and made mini muffins.

I doubled the recipe following all directions and ingredients. Instead of using the optional raisins I used pecans crushed up. If you use the nuts you can use as much or as little as you want depending on your taste. These were fantastic with nuts I made a few with no strudel topping and no nuts they weren't as great as the ones with the nuts, the nuts really bring out more flavor. My son said they're okay they need more pumpkin which I do agree if you're doing no raisins, no nuts, or no strudel topping they need to have a little bit more flavor. Overall I will be making these again with the nuts and strudel topping.
Excellent, I made double the streusel topping with pecans.

I made these without the topping bc I was short on time and these are *amazing*! I can only imagine what the topping tastes like. They taste like a delicious cake, they’re light & airy and they have the perfect blend of tastes. I also like heartier, denser muffins but these are equally delicious. Will make these again.
This is an awesome recipe! I only did 1/2 cup sugar and 1 1/2 cups brown sugar. Makes a lot more than I thought too! Very moist and delicious! Thanks for posting this recipe!
Outstanding. I cut the sugar with some Splenda to reduce calories, and tossed in some walnuts. Wow, these are exceptionally moist and flavorful!! The only pumpkin muffin recipe I'll ever make.

This is the best muffin I have ever made!!!! I am always in search of "the ultimate" recipe. This is it!! I made an error on this batch, and it still turned out great. In the middle of the recipe, I realized I was out of eggs! (I am NEVER out of eggs) but today I was. I had to stop everything, run to the store for eggs. So when I got back into baking, I ended up forgetting one egg and the vanilla. Duh. But the recipe was still fab-u-lous! PS..I added chopped pecans and more golden raisins. YUM! Made exactly 18 muffins, and I used 1 can pumpkin. The 4 tsp pumpkin pie spice brings out the pumpkin flavor!
These are great. Made half with raisins half without and they were a big hit. Beautiful to smell and eat. Thanks

These were delicious! Thank you for sharing. I took other posters’ advice and used less oil—3/4 cup of canola oil. I will try using applesauce instead next time and add raw sugar on top too. I also substituted 2 cups of the flour with whole wheat pastry flour. The result was delicious and moist with a little less fat and some added fiber.

I really liked these muffins, I think as much as my old stand by recipe. They just need a bit more pumpkin flavor, which I will improve upon when I make them again. Note: add more pumpkin and spices! I agreed with Naples34102 regarding the streusel, and combined those ingredients in the traditional way. It was a nice topping without being overpowering. I combined all muffin ingredients in 1 bowl, starting with the wet first and adding the dry last...no need for a blender, just use a whisk. I, too, added a few more raisins and I think the next time I will add a few nuts also. Reduced the recipe to make 6 muffins, and ended up with 8, this the recipe definitely yields more than listed.
Excellent! I followed the recipe just as written. Delicious, moist, nice springy texture. Very, very good.
I love the streusel l topping on a muffin, this is very festive and delicious for the Holidays.

I have made these muffins a few times and they’re delicious! I followed the top review, but didn’t add raisins, and doubled the streusel topping. They freeze very well! 

I also never have pumpkin spice on hand so make my own using: 4 tsp. ground cinnamon, 1 tsp. ground nutmeg, 1 tsp. ground ginger.
Very very good and easy to make!

I made these as written. I'm not crazy about the oats in the crumble topping and the pumpkin flavor isn't very strong, so next time (my husband really liked these, so I'll try the recipe again) I'll omit the oats from the topping and add some extra pumpkin pie spice.
Excellent. Made for a gathering and when I went to get one to try they were gone! Will make again. But the story is that they were the bomb.

Certainly I made changes cause I cook with what I have on hand. Mushed up an apple and a banana together instead of the apple sauce, used cinnamon, cardamom, and allspice for spices and used dried cranberries. Turned out delicious!
I added a few pecans to the top of the muffins.
I forgot the streusel topping, but it was still amazing.

These turned out fabulous. I made a lot of modifications. I used gluten free Krustean flour. Duck eggs and natural sugar. No white sugar. And no apple sauce. I used plain low fat Greek yogurt instead. The other thing I changed was I used extra virgin coconut oil. These came out rich sweet and moist. 
I tripled the vanilla, doubled pumpkin pie spice,and added more cinnamon. Then added both milk chocolate and semi sweet chocolate chips. 
 And I made them huge. Everyone loved them they disappeared fast.
I made these exactly like the recipe states and they were INCREDIBLE!!!!! SUPER SUPER YUMMY, THE KIDS LOVED LOVED THEM.

Great recipe! It makes a lot, too. I reduced the granulated sugar by a half cup and it was still very delicious. I also subbed one cup of whole wheat flour instead of using all all-purpose. Doubled the streusel like other reviewers suggested. It made 24 muffins and one very full mini loaf pan. Thanks for the recipe!
These muffins are delicious! I doubled the recipe and got exactly 36. The ingredients were all things I had in my pantry, which I love! They were a hit with my whole family.

I followed the recommendations of some bakers and used the full can of pumpkin puree and doubled the streusel topping. I got 18 nice and fully rounded muffins. Mine baked perfectly in 25 minutes. If I had pecans on hand I would have used these as well in the topping.

I used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. I also substituted more pumpkin for the apple sauce. Used whole grain amaranth flour instead of white. And for the topping I used pumpkin seeds and granola with the butter and sugar.

These are so great!! I didn't add the raisins, but put in pecans and walnuts instead, lightly chopped. I also cut down the sugar to 3/4 cup of each and they were still very sweet. I'll probably cut it to 1/2 cup of each next time. 

Make double the streusel it calls for, you won't be sorry!
I made these pumpkin streusel muffins. It was so good I will make these again. So moist and yummy.
Will make again. Used a little less sugar, including replacing some of it with Splenda. Reduced oil by half, increasing apple sauce to compensate. Added finely chopped pecans to batter. Excellent!
Made them exactly as the recipe was written ... delicious !!!

Delicious, moist, and a perfect balance of pumpkin, spices, and sweetness. As others mentioned, the recipe yielded 24 regular size muffins, so I doubled the streusel recipe and had enough for all 24. I also added an extra 1/2 tsp. of vanilla, but other than that, I followed the recipe as written, and they turned out perfect. My entire family loved them. Thank you for a fantastic fall recipe!
Delicious! Crumble for the too is a perfect touch!
Added extra Vanilla & Cinnamon.... this recipe is AWESOME!!! Muffins were moist & full of flavor!
I subbed a mixture of honey and molasses for the white sugar, and replaced the vegetable oil with 1/3 C butter and 1/3 C applesauce and added pumpkin seeds on top of the struesel.
Perfect fall treat!! My husband and daughter loved it. Maybe next time I'll add walnuts or pecans to the streusel.
Only thing I added was pecans but this recipe is perfection!
love these! didn't have apple sauce so I used sour cream and I also didn't have pumpkin pie spice so I used a little nutmeg and cinnamon. turned out great!
These muffins are great for breakfast. I plan on making them again for Thanksgiving weekend’s visitors!
These are delicious!! I will definitely be making them again and again!

These muffins were just okay. Nothing extra special, though took a lot of ingredients and lengthy process. the topping was not nearly enough for the amount of muffins and kind of oozed over the muffins instead of crumbled. They muffins could have also been more moist.
Love this recipe. I add a few extras like pecans in the batter and pumpkin seeds on top. It’s absolutely my favorite muffins
These are moist and amazingly delicious! The entire family loved them. Even three kids under 10

I made these for my grand children, they were a hit! I left out the raisins, no one wanted them included. I also used einkorn whole wheat flour as that is what I had. I was afraid they would be heavy but were perfect. The recipe made 24 muffins so I doubled the streusel and not a bit too much. Today I put a second batch in the oven, the first batch was gone in about 18 hours!

I made these for my grand children, they were a hit! I left out the raisins, no one wanted them included. I also used einkorn whole wheat flour as that is what I had. I was afraid they would be heavy but were perfect. The recipe made 24 muffins so I doubled the streusel and not a bit too much. Today I put a second batch in the oven, the first batch was gone in about 18 hours!

As is typical for me, I said I want pumpkin muffins for breakfast...I start to make them and then have to play the substitution game because I'm out of lots of things...so these are my adjustments...use the full can of pumpkin, 1.25 cups brown sugar and no white sugar, use 1/2 cup oil and 1/2 cup Greek yogurt and skip the applesauce, replace raisins with 3/4 cup chopped walnuts, add 6oz mini chocolate chips, skip the topping. I got 12 regular and 6 jumbo muffins and they were moist and soft and delicious!
